Package controllers

Class CourController

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • controllers.CourController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    @WebServlet(name="CourController",
            urlPatterns="/CourController")
public class CourController
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    The CourController class extends HttpServlet and is responsible for handling all the requests related to the 'Cour' entity, such as creating, updating, deleting, and displaying courses. It interacts with the CourDao to persist and retrieve course data.

    It supports the GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE HTTP methods to facilitate the CRUD operations on course data. The servlet is annotated with WebServlet, mapping it to the URL pattern '/CourController'.

    Each method in this class is designed to handle a specific HTTP request method, gather the necessary data from the request, perform operations using the DAO layer, and forward the response to the appropriate JSP page.

    See Also:

      • doGet

        protected void doGet​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
              throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Handles the HTTP GET method.

        This method determines the action to be taken (such as deleting a course, updating course information, showing the enrollment form, or displaying the list of courses) based on the 'act' parameter from the request. It then forwards the request to the appropriate JSP page with the necessary attributes set.

        Overrides:
        doGet in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:
        request - servlet request
        response - servlet response
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - if a servlet-specific error occurs
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • doPost

        protected void doPost​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
               throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Handles the HTTP POST method.

        This method is responsible for creating a new course record based on the form data received in the request. After creating the course, it retrieves an updated list of courses and forwards to the course listing JSP page.

        Overrides:
        doPost in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:
        request - servlet request
        response - servlet response
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - if a servlet-specific error occurs
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • doDelete

        protected void doDelete​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
                 throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Handles the HTTP DELETE method.

        This method is called to delete a course. It uses the EtudiantCourService to handle the deletion operation and then forwards to the course listing JSP page with an updated list of courses.

        Overrides:
        doDelete in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:

        resp - servlet response

      • doPut

        protected void doPut​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
              throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Handles the HTTP PUT method.

        This method updates an existing course's information based on the form data received in the request. It then retrieves an updated list of courses and forwards to the course listing JSP page.
